lines.content: This project is based on the AddressBook-Level3 project created by the [SE-EDU initiative](https://se-education.org).
It is modified to create a **task management application** named _TaskWise_.

It aims to provide the project manager of a CS2103T group a fast and intuitive CLI to manage their team project, by providing them a platform to manage different deadlines for different tasks, allowing them to be more on task and keep up with deadlines within one project.
Below and some of the features that TaskWise provides:
- **Add and delete tasks**: Add and delete project tasks to the task list.
- **Mark tasks as done**: Mark tasks as done when they are completed.
- **Edit tasks**: Edit the details of a task.
- **Find tasks**: Find tasks by searching for keywords.
- **Add priority to tasks**: Add priority to tasks to indicate their importance.
- **Add deadline to tasks**: Add deadline to tasks to indicate when they are due.
- **Add notes to tasks**: Add notes to tasks to provide additional information.
- **Allocate tasks to team members**: Allocate tasks to team members to indicate who is responsible for the task.
- **Sort tasks**: Sort tasks by priority, deadline.
We are a team based in the [School of Computing, National University of Singapore](http://www.comp.nus.edu.sg).
You can reach us at the email `seer[at]comp.nus.edu.sg`
* Responsibilities: Implementing and maintaining DevOps tools and processes on GitHub
* Responsibilities: Responsible for the quality of various project documents such as User Guide.
Welcome to the TaskWise Developer Guide!
Welcome to the TaskWise Developer Guide!
Through this guide you will learn more about the vision behind TaskWise, how TaskWise was built and how you as a Developer can use TaskWise and build upon it!
# Documentation, Logging, Testing, Configuration and DevOps

Provide the project manager of a CS2103T group a fast and intuitive CLI to manage their team project, by providing them a platform to manage different deadlines for different tasks, allowing them to be more on task and keep up with deadlines within one project.
Our target audience of this application are Project Managers of CS2103T Group Projects.
| Priority           | As a ...               | I want to ...                                                               | So that I can...                                     |
| :star::star::star: | user                   | be able to add tasks to my list of tasks                                    | so that tasks can be tracked                         |
| :star::star::star: | project manager        | be able to delete tasks from my list of tasks                               | remove tasks that are completed or wrongly added     |
| :star::star::star: | project manager        | be able to view all my tasks                                                | get a high level overview of what needs to be done   |
| :star::star::star: | project manager        | be able to mark tasks that were unmarked                                    | update the progress of the task                      |
| :star::star::star: | clumsy project manager | be able to unmark tasks that were marked in case I accidentally marked them | I can undo my mistake                                |
| :star::star::star: | forgetful manager      | be told that I have entered an invalid command                              | so that I know that the command I entered is invalid |
* A task is added into the system list of tasks.
1. User inputs command to add a task.
2. System adds the task into list of task and <u>[displays the updated task list (UC03)](#UC03-View-all-tasks)</u>.
1a1. System warns that the <u>[command is illegal (UC07)](#UC07-Warn-on-Illegal-Command)</u>.
1a2. User acknowledges and closes the warning.
* The specified task is successfully deleted from the system.
1. User inputs command to delete a certain task.
2. System deletes the task and <u>[displays the updated task list (UC03)](#UC03-View-all-tasks)</u>.
1a1. System warns that the <u>[command is invalid (UC06)](#UC06-Warn-on-Invalid-Command)</u>.
1a2. User acknowledges and closes the warning.
1b1. System warns that the <u>[command is illegal (UC07)](#UC07-Warn-on-Illegal-Command)</u>.
1b2. User acknowledges and closes the warning.
2. System displays a list of tasks to the user.
1a1. System warns that the <u>[command is invalid (UC06)](#UC06-Warn-on-Invalid-Command)</u>.
1a2. User acknowledges and closes the warning.
### UC04: Marks a task as done
* The specified task is successfully marked as complete in the system.
1. User inputs command to mark a certain task as done.
2. System updates and marks the task as done.
3. Updated list of tasks is <u>[displayed to the user (UC03)](#UC03-View-all-tasks)</u>.
1a1. System warns that the <u>[command is invalid (UC06)](#UC06-Warn-on-Invalid-Command)</u>.
1a2. User acknowledges and closes the warning.
1b1. System warns that the <u>[command is illegal (UC07)](#UC07-Warn-on-Illegal-Command)</u>.
1b2. User acknowledges and closes the warning.
### UC05: Unmarks a task that was marked as done
* The specified task is successfully marked as incomplete in the system.
1. User inputs command to unmark certain task.
2. System updates and marks the task as incomplete.
3. Updated list of tasks is <u>[displayed to the user (UC03)](#UC03-View-all-tasks)</u>.
1a1. System warns that the <u>[command is invalid (UC06)](#UC06-Warn-on-Invalid-Command)</u>.
1a2. User acknowledges and closes the warning.
1b1. System warns that the <u>[command is illegal (UC07)](#UC07-Warn-on-Illegal-Command)</u>.
1b2. User acknowledges and closes the warning.
2. System warns user that the command entered is invalid.
* Illegal command will not be executed.
1. User inputs an illegal command (valid command but the user has no permission to execute the command or argument is invalid).
2. System warns user that the command entered is illegal and cannot be completed.
1. Should work on any mainstream OS as long as it has `Java 11` or above installed.
2. A user should be able to accomplish most of the tasks using commands rather than using mouse.
* **Argument**: A word or number or a sequence of words or numbers that represent
* **Command**: A sequence of words that represents an action that TaskWise can understand and execute
Welcome to the TaskWise User Guide!
From this User Guide, you will learn:
- how TaskWise can help enhance your project management workflows

This User Guide will guide you along in learning how to use TaskWise and what the different features of TaskWise is. If you are already an experienced user, click [here](#Features) to get to the summary of the different features of TaskWise and [here](#Commands) to get to the summary of commands that you can enter into TaskWise.
Otherwise, read on to find out more on how TaskWise can help you be a more effective project manager for your CS2103T project!
The next few sections will detail the different features that
* Adds a task to the task list
* Popup window with text: “[task status][task name] has been added successfully!”
* The task entry will be displayed on the main GUI screen

| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text: “Please enter a
valid task in this format “add {task name}”! |
* Deletes a task from the task list
* string `delete`, followed by a space ` `, followed by an integer
* Popup window showing the task: “[task status][task name] has been deleted successfully!”
* The original task on the GUI window will be struck through
#### Cause: Wrong Number - Out of Bounds
| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text:  “Please provide a valid integer task number” |
| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text:  “Please provide a valid integer task number” |
#### Cause: Non-Integer Input for List Index
| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text:  “Please provide a valid integer task number” |
* Displays the task list to the user
* A popup with the text ”Here are all your tasks!”
The task list is empty! Try adding tasks with the add command first! (when task list is empty)

| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text: “The task list is empty!
Try adding tasks with the add command first!" |
* Any integer that is between 0 to (total number of tasks - 1) inclusive
* Popup window displaying string: "Task [Task name] has been marked as done!"
#### Cause: Wrong Number - Out of Bounds
| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text: “Please provide a valid integer task number” |
| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text: “Please provide a valid integer task number” |
#### Cause: Non-Integer Input for List Index
| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text: “Please provide a valid integer task number” |
* Any integer that is between 0 to (total number of tasks - 1) inclusive
* Popup window displaying string: "Task [Task name] has been marked as undone!"
#### Cause: Task Number does not Exist
| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text: “Please provide a valid integer task number” |
| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text: “Please provide a valid integer task number” |
#### Cause: Task Number is not a Number
| Expected Outputs | Popup window displaying text: “Please provide a valid integer task number” |
* Inform the user if they have entered an unknown command
* Unrecognised Command → Popup window displays text: “The command you entered is invalid! Press “help” for available commands!”
TaskWise is a task managing application used by CS2103/T task managers.
The user interacts with it via the Command Line Interface (CLI) and it has a Graphical User
Interface (GUI) made using JavaFX. It is written in Java, and it has about _______ LoC.
Given below are my contributions to the project.
# Teh De Sheng Sean's Project Portfolio Page
TaskWise is a task managing application used by CS2103/T task managers.
The user interacts with it via the Command Line Interface (CLI) and it has a Graphical User
Interface (GUI) made using JavaFX. It is written in Java, and it has about _______ LoC.
Given below are my contributions to the project.
* What it does: Marks a task within the task list as completed.
* Justifications: Allows the user to mark tasks as completed to allow the task manager to keep track of
tasks and whether they are finished or not.
* Project management: Team leader for the group; Ensures goals of the team are being met and keeps group focused
on tasks that need to be done.
* User Guide: Added documentation on the mark command.
* Developer Guide: Added documentation on the mark command.
* Contribution to team-based tasks: Created skeletal PPP for the group; Added a few issues on GitHub for group.
